methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: This is the name of the flag. Flag names always use underscores, not hyphens, for example: max_allowed_packet

params.name: data.type
params.description: The type of the flag. Flags are typed to being BOOLEAN, STRING, INTEGER or NONE. NONE is used for flags which do not take a value, such as skip_grant_tables.

params.name: data.applies_to
params.description: The database version this flag applies to. Can be MYSQL_8_0, MYSQL_5_6, or MYSQL_5_7.

params.name: data.allowed_string_values
params.description: For STRING flags, a list of strings that the value can be set to.

params.name: data.min_value
params.description: For INTEGER flags, the minimum allowed value.

params.name: data.max_value
params.description: For INTEGER flags, the maximum allowed value.

params.name: data.requires_restart
params.description: Indicates whether changing this flag will trigger a database restart. Only applicable to Second Generation instances.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: This is always sql#flag.

params.name: data.in_beta
params.description: Whether or not the flag is considered in beta.

params.name: data.allowed_int_values
params.description: Use this field if only certain integers are accepted. Can be combined with min_value and max_value to add additional values.
